metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2112 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Exception Handler in TYPO3 4.4.x before 4.4.15, 4.5.x before 4.5.15, 4.6.x before 4.6.8, and 4.7 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via exception messages.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2112` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

typo3 - 4.5.16+dfsg3-1
typo3-database - 4.5.16+dfsg3-1
typo3-dummy - 4.5.16+dfsg3-1
typo3-src-4.5 - 4.5.16+dfsg3-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> according to upstream, requires 3rd-party extensions

criterions.comment: typo3-src package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.5.16+dfsg3-1').
